turns.content: One example of a scholarly article that shows evidence that gamification and interactivity can increase reading comprehension among children is "Game-based learning and student engagement: A study of the effect of Quizizz on student engagement and performance" by N.J. Draper, D.C. Brown, and D. Henderson published in the Journal of Learning Analytics in 2016. The study found that the use of the game-based learning platform Quizizz led to higher student engagement and performance compared to traditional instruction methods.

Amazon Cockatoo, our proposed reading comprehension app for children, has a bright future ahead. Our focus will be on continuously improving and expanding the app's features, as well as reaching a wider audience of parents and educators. Moving forward, we plan to collaborate with schools and literacy organizations to integrate our app into their reading curricula. We will also be gathering feedback from parents, educators, and children to improve the app's functionality and usability. Additionally, we will be continuously monitoring and updating our security measures to ensure that the sensitive data we collect remains secure. Our long-term goal is to become the leading reading comprehension app for children, providing a valuable resource for parents and educators to help children succeed in reading. With our dedication to evidence-based strategies, engaging user experience, and strong security measures, we are confident that Amazon Cockatoo will continue to make a positive impact on children's reading comprehension for years to come.
